page.title: 02THE THREE J's, DUNDEE
page.content: The three J's (Jute,Jam & Journalism) were the three major industries in Dundee;all are still present today. { JUTE:}Probably the main industry. Strathern Road in Broughty Ferry was claimed to be the richest mile in the world-{"Millionaires' Mile".}This was where the{"Jute Barons"}who owned the Dundee Mills had their mansions.Now, however,only one factory producing jute only remains in Dundee:{Manhatten {Works}employ 400 workers and produce 180_200 tons of jute per week. { JAM}: The most famous of the jam makers was by Keillor of Dundee, credited with the invention of marmalade and now owned by Okhai. { JOURNALISM}: A major employer: D.C. Thomson, a printer and publisher with a world-wide circulation, is based in Dundee. Among their 71 titles are the Dandy,Beano and Sunday Post.
